word.entryDescription: a piece of clothing that a girl or woman wears on the lower half of the body
word.entryExample: She's wearing a lovely skirt!

word.entryDescription: the set of bones in the head, particularly those which protect the brain
word.entryExample: Helmets are used to protect the head and skull.

word.entryDescription: the space above the earth's surface in which you can see clouds, stars, the sun, etc
word.entryExample: The sky is blue and the sun is shining.

word.entryDescription: a computer program used to make free voice calls over the Internet to anyone else who is also using Skype
word.entryExample: I often talk with my friends on Skype.

word.entryDescription: a very tall building
word.entryExample: There are lots of skyscrapers in Times Square.

word.entryDescription: a person owned by another person and working for them for no money
word.entryExample: The slave was nothing in the eyes of the law.

word.entryDescription: a vehicle with long pieces of wood fitted to the bottom instead of wheels used to travel over snow
word.entryExample: The sledge hit a bump and I fell off.

word.entryDescription: to be in an unconscious state when your body and mind are resting, and your eyes are closed
word.entryExample: The cat likes to sleep in my bedroom.

word.entryDescription: nightclothes (clothes that you wear in bed)
word.entryExample: This involves looking through the different sections of underwear, formal clothes, sleepwear and accessories when all you really want is a new pair of jeans.

word.entryDescription: a thin flat piece of food cut from something larger
word.entryExample: Next, slice and fry the mushrooms.

word.entryDescription: cut into flat pieces
word.entryExample: By the 1950s, breakfast as it’s known in the UK – with sliced bread, toast and breakfast cereals – had arrived.

word.entryDescription: thin in an attractive way
word.entryExample: That tall and slim girl next to Josh is my sister.

word.entryDescription: to lose your balance or fall because your foot suddenly and uncontrollably moves along a wet, icy, etc surface
word.entryExample: I laughed at the man who slipped on the banana skin, but stopped when I saw he'd broken his wrist.

word.entryDescription: a side of a hill or mountain
word.entryExample: This slope is too steep for beginners.

word.entryDescription: not moving fast
word.entryExample: This train is really slow.

word.entryDescription: in a way that is not fast
word.entryExample: She walked slowly out of the room.

word.entryDescription: not large
word.entryExample: A hamster is a small animal.

word.entryDescription: intelligent, sensible or quick-thinking
word.entryExample: You're smart, you'll find the answer.

word.entryDescription: looking stylish and tidy
word.entryExample: William's mum wants him to look smart.

word.entryDescription: a mobile phone with some of the functions of a computer (e.g. using apps and the Internet)
word.entryExample: Why did Tony buy a case for his smartphone?

word.entryDescription: to sense something with your nose
word.entryExample: When you've got a cold and you can't smell through your nose, things have no taste.

word.entryDescription: to resemble the aroma of something
word.entryExample: What does it smell like? Fried food.

word.entryDescription: to move the corners of your mouth upwards, usually in a friendly or happy way
word.entryExample: I'm taking a photo. Smile please!

word.entryDescription: gas produced by something burning
word.entryExample: We could see clouds of smoke coming from the factorys' chimney stack.

word.entryDescription: sucking in smoke from a cigarette, cigar, etc
word.entryExample: Do you think smoking should be banned?

word.entryDescription: without problems or difficulties; in a steady way
word.entryExample: The houseboat floats smoothly down the river.

word.entryDescription: a small amount of food which you eat between meals
word.entryExample: They ate snacks or sandwiches when they were on the train.

word.entryDescription: a long thin animal that has no legs and moves along the ground
word.entryExample: Are you afraid of snakes?

word.entryDescription: (of decision or judgement) made quickly and without careful thought
word.entryExample: A snap decision is a very quick choice.

word.entryDescription: to suddenly push air out of your nose while making a sound
word.entryExample: I'm going to sneeze, I'm sorry!

word.entryDescription: soft white ice that falls from the sky, and may form a layer on the ground
word.entryExample: I love playing in the snow.

word.entryDescription: a ball that you make out of snow and use to throw at somebody/something
word.entryExample: Are you going to have snowball fights?

word.entryDescription: a sport or activity in which you ride on a snowboard
word.entryExample: You can go snowboarding or sledging down the hills.

word.entryDescription: a fall of snow: or the amount of snow that falls in a particular period of time
word.entryExample: In the UK it's difficult because the transport stops with even a little bit of snowfall.

word.entryDescription: a human figure you make outside by rolling up large balls of snow
word.entryExample: Let's make a snowman now!

word.entryDescription: having a lot of snow
word.entryExample: I've seen tall snowy mountain tops and sandy beaches.

word.entryDescription: and for that reason
word.entryExample: I was late for school, so I couldn't talk about my project in class.

word.entryDescription: in order for something to happen
word.entryExample: Go to bed early, so that you don't feel tired the next day.

word.entryDescription: a long series of programmes about the lives of a group of characters
word.entryExample: Greek tragedies form the basis of soap operas.

word.entryDescription: to rise quickly and suddenly to a high position or level
word.entryExample: The price of property has soared in recent years.

word.entryDescription: connected with society and its organization
word.entryExample: The wolf is a social animal that is a member of a complex society.

word.entryDescription: websites and software programs used for sharing messages, photographs, and other information, especially in online communities or forums
word.entryExample: She's on her phone all the time – texting and on social media sites.

word.entryDescription: by or with respect to society; in a social matter
word.entryExample: The government is trying to make speeding socially unacceptable.

word.entryDescription: one of the things you wear on your feet under your shoes
word.entryExample: Where are my socks?

word.entryDescription: a soft comfortable seat that more than one person can sit on
word.entryExample: Our new sofa was very expensive.

word.entryDescription: not hard; feeling pleasant to touch
word.entryExample: The T-shirt is really soft and it isn't too warm.

word.entryDescription: a metal container in which a cold drink not containing alcohol is sold
word.entryExample: Mr Campbell adds the soft drink cans to the other recycling things.

word.entryDescription: programs for computers and other technological equipment
word.entryExample: He can design computer software.

word.entryDescription: the material on the ground in which plants grow
word.entryExample: This deforestation caused the soil to go.

word.entryDescription: energy derived from the sun's radiation
word.entryExample: Passive houses are heated primarily by solar energy and from heat generated by people and electrical equipment.
